title: Lawmakers Push to Pass Revised Trade Deal as Year’s End Approaches
text:
WASHINGTON—Lawmakers worry that the window to pass the Trump administration’s renegotiated trade deal with Mexico and Canada is closing, and if negotiations don’t conclude soon, the pact’s prospects could fade against political priorities in the coming election year.

For weeks, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif.) has said Democrats are on a path to approving the deal, known as the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement, or USMCA, though President Trump has cast doubt on any deal happening while Democrats lead an impeachment inquiry...
description: Lawmakers worry that the window to pass the Trump administration’s renegotiated trade deal with Mexico and Canada is closing, and if negotiations don’t conclude soon, the pact’s prospects could fade against political priorities in the coming election year.
